definition: refers to Tiananmen incident of 4th June 1989

sentences.english: In 1860, Lincoln became President of the United States.
sentences.chinese: 在一八六四年，林肯成爲美國總統。

sentences.english: The 64-type girders have been widely and successfully used as the guiding beams for bridge erectors.
sentences.chinese: 六四式軍用梁用作架橋機導梁結構已取得巨大成功。

sentences.english: One attack on Naples , Italy dropped 6400 kg of bombs.
sentences.chinese: 一個攻擊那不勒斯，意大利下降六四零零千克炸彈。

sentences.english: Lincoln, president of the United States, was murdered in 1864.
sentences.chinese: 林肯，美國總統，在一八六四年被槍殺。

sentences.english: What follows is the process of his being awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 1964.
sentences.chinese: 以下是他被頒贈一九六四年諾貝爾和平獎的過程。

sentences.english: Pingliang revoked in January 1964, the restoration of Pingliang County.
sentences.chinese: 一九六四年元月撤銷平涼市，恢復平涼縣。

definition: memorial activity 35 days after a person's death
the solid and broken lines of the eight trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], e.g. ☶
to have one's house burned down/fire disaster
to foretell the future using the trigrams of the Book of Changes 易經|易经
divinatory diagram/one of the eight divinatory trigrams of the Book of Changes 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1]/one of the sixty-four divinatory hexagrams of the Book of Changes 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1]
to obey/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing wood and wind/☴/ancient Chinese compass point: 135° (southeast)
one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing mountain/☶/ancient Chinese compass point: 45° (northeast)
